lines.text: Do you speak English?
Do I look like some goddamned foreigner?
I'm sorry.
Of course I speak English, also Creole, French, Spanish. I'm a native born American Indian, not some half breed immigrant like you all.
Are those pants going on or coming off?
Going on.
Are your salmon swimming upstream?
Well, we've made it to Pickett's Charge. 15,000 men died here.
Now it's 15,001.
I won't miss Cal's inauguration if this eye turns red, white, and blue!
Charlie, get some clothes on!
That's not what you said last night!
Killy, why don't you move in permanently?
I don't want to die from a terminal orgasm!

[in a mixture of embarrassment and amusement]
What are YOU grinnin' at?

[chuckling]
From the way you jumped up there, you'd have thought you'd sat on a SNAKE.
Well, I didn't want you to get excited, that's all.
[pause]
Was it - - exciting?
No - - just heavy.
Damn it, Killy - - you could have lied just this once!
Ah, well, I DID lie... you weren't just heavy, you felt like a ton!
You are an insufferable ASS!

[smiling sarcastically]
And since you like being top dog, you can take the top bunk.

[snorts indignantly, then climbs up the ladder and plops down on the bunk, still fuming. She then takes off one shoe and hurls in at Killy, so that it bounces off his back. He turns in surprise, and she holds the other shoe poised as if to throw that one at him, too. But then she thinks better of it, and just sends the shoe whizzing past his ear and thumping against the wall behind him]
If Bracken's been getting news of our whereabouts, well, he'll be there and waiting for us.
Well, I'd rather you were here because I've sent part of my team to meet us.
Don't you think that's subjecting the First Lady to some risk?
Lamb for the slaughter?
Oh, Killy - what a way with words! Can't you put it another way?
Okay - how about, "worm wriggling on a hook"?
Uhhfph - forget it! I'll take the lamb!
It's been fun on the merry-go-round, but I'm running out of tickets, Ma'am.

[pulling up in his car in a somewhat secluded parking garage, and then scowlingly watching Eddie Bracken emerge from a shadowy corner and saunter importantly towards Bunsen's vehicle]
A **million dollars** is a lot of money for NEAR MISSES!

[leaning his hand imperiously on the door-frame of Bunsen's car and bending down slightly to peer coldly at him]
Terror... is a very expensive trade... SENATOR.

[glaring at Bracken with an indignant air of frustrated fury]
Well, GET ON WITH IT - - or I'll hire a HIT MAN to HIT **YOU**!

[smiling coolly in sneering derisive "I'm the best in the business, and so there's nobody who would dare try to come after me" confidence, and regarding Bunsen with unconcerned sarcasm, like a headmaster reacting to the noisy tirade of a juvenile delinquent]
You've got a BIG MOUTH, Senator - -
[leans in closer to make his next words more impressive and menacing]
